questions.question: â“ What is Default Buy?
questions.answer: â”—â” The Default Buy is what you set to enable faster trading for transactions.

questions.question: â“ What is Slippage?
questions.answer: â”—â” Slippage allows you to adjust the allowed percentage difference between the expected price of a transaction and the actual price. The default is 1%.

questions.question: â“ What is a Priority Fee?
questions.answer: â”—â” The priority fee is set to .0001 SOL by default and is the fee you pay to ensure faster processing of your transactions.

questions.question: â“ What is MEV?
questions.answer: â”—â” MEV stands for Miner Extractable Value, which prevents frontrunning by using MEV protection. Also known as sandwiched. This feature is on by default.

questions.question: â“ What is the Target MarketCap?
questions.answer: â”—â” The target market capitalization range for your calls.

questions.question: â“ What are Market Cap parameters?
questions.answer: â”—â” This monitors the ratio of tokens held by the top 10 holders.

questions.question: â“ What is the Developer Wallet Percentage?
questions.answer: â”—â” Market cap parameters allow you to choose the parameters of market cap Algora will send you. You may choose multiple parameters at once.

questions.question: â“ What is 10 Top Holders?
questions.answer: â”—â” This monitors the ratio of tokens held by the top 10 holders.

questions.question: â“ What is the Dev Wallet Percentage?
questions.answer: â”—â” This monitors the percentage of tokens held by the developer wallet. Many cases, the dev wallet bundles supply or sells after launch.

questions.question: â“ What is the Freeze Status?
questions.answer: â”—â” Freeze authority is a security feature on the Solana blockchain that gives a specific wallet address the power to freeze or unfreeze token accounts. This feature is similar to mint authority, which allows an account to create new units of a token.

questions.question: â“ How to change settings?
questions.answer: â”—â” Use /settings to change your preferences.

questions.question: â“ What is call strength?
questions.answer: â”—â” Call strength accumulates many data sets and is formulated by the algorithm to give the strength of a call/signal.

questions.question: â“ What is ATH?
questions.answer: â”—â” ATH stands for All-Time High. This represents the highest Market Cap the token of the call/signal has reached at the time itâ€™s sent to the user.

questions.question: â“ What is LP locked?
questions.answer: â”—â” When a token is locked as a liquidity provider (LP), it means that the token is being used to provide liquidity to a pool and cannot be drained by the dev.

questions.question: â“ What is the token win rate?
questions.answer: â”—â” Token win rate is an accumulation of trades in a token that is formulated to give a percentage based on buys and sells at the time of the call/signal to the user.

questions.question: â“ What is Whale Detection?
questions.answer: â”—â” Whale detection is a list of whales in a token with a combined portfolio of over $100k.

questions.question: â“ What is the referral program rewards?
questions.answer: â”—â” The referral program pays out daily to your Algora wallet and is 20% revenue of subscriptions and 30% of each trade (of the 1% tax per trade).

questions.question: â“ Is my money safe using the Algora trading feature?
questions.answer: â”—â” Yes. We take security very seriously and high-level security features have been implemented to protect all users and their assets.

questions.question: â“ Where to contact support?
questions.answer: â”—â” Join our Telegram group for support at @AlgoraChat

questions.question: â“ Does Algora have an X (Twitter) account?
questions.answer: â”—â” Follow the official page at X.com/AlgoraBot

questions.question: â“ Does Algora have a website?
questions.answer: â”—â” Yes. Visit AlgoraBot.com
